item.title: ジョージ・カーリンの遺族が『Dudesy』メーカーと和解、YouTubeビデオとポッドキャストの削除に合意、彼らは当初 "AI "ジョージ・カーリンが使用されていると主張していた（Christopher Kuo/New York Times）
item.description:
Christopher Kuo / New York Times:
George Carlin's estate settles with the makers of Dudesy, who agree to remove their YouTube video and podcast they originally claimed used an “AI” George Carlin  —  The estate had accused two podcast hosts of infringing on its copyrights by training an A.I. algorithm on five decades of Mr. Carlin's work.

item.title: 米ヘッジファンドのハンターブルックがニュースルーム「ハンターブルック・メディア」を立ち上げ、1億ドルを調達。
item.description:
Financial Times:
US-based hedge fund Hunterbrook launches its newsroom, Hunterbrook Media, after raising $100M to make trades based on scoops uncovered by its reporters  —  Target of Hunterbrook's first story questions ethics of it taking a short position in its stock  —  A US hedge fund has raised $100mn …

item.title: アイオワ州当局、議会へのプレスパスを拒否された独立系政治ブロガー、ローラ・ベリン氏との訴訟で和解、アイオワ州は彼女の弁護士に4万9000ドルを支払う（Tyler Jett/Des Moines Register）
item.description:
Tyler Jett / Des Moines Register:
Iowa officials settle a suit with independent political blogger Laura Belin, who was denied a press pass to the legislature; Iowa will pay her attorneys $49K  —  Iowa state officials agreed Tuesday to pay attorney's fees and change state House policies to settle a lawsuit from a liberal blogger …

item.title: 情報源ディズニーの約8.3％の株式を保有する最大の投資家であるバンガード・グループは、4月3日の年次総会でディズニーの取締役候補に投票する（Bloomberg）。
item.description:
Bloomberg:
Sources: Vanguard Group, the biggest investor in Disney with a roughly 8.3% stake, is voting for Disney's board nominees at the annual meeting on April 3  —  NYC Comptroller on Disney Proxy Fight, Congestion Pricing … Vanguard is the biggest investor in Disney, with a roughly 8.3% stake, Bloomberg-compiled data show.

item.title: 2023年、マリオン郡レコード紙の親会社と編集・発行人のエリック・マイヤー氏が、事務所とマイヤー氏の自宅に対する警察の家宅捜索をめぐり連邦訴訟を起こす（John Hanna/Associated Press）。
item.description:
John Hanna / Associated Press:
The Marion County Record's parent and Eric Meyer, its editor and publisher, file a federal lawsuit over police raids of its offices and Meyer's home in 2023  —  A weekly central Kansas newspaper and its publisher filed a federal lawsuit Monday over police raids last summer of its offices …

A look at the lawyers using defamation lawsuits to fight political disinformation with a focus on key spreaders, like Alex Jones  —  “I've always despised bullies that pick on defenseless or seemingly defenseless people,” said Michael J. Gottlieb, who has represented clients targeted …

item.title: ミラマックスがジョナサン・グリックマンをCEOに指名、彼の独立系映画・TVスタジオ、パノラミック・メディアを買収（Kristen Lopez/The Wrap）
item.description:
Kristen Lopez / The Wrap:
Miramax names Jonathan Glickman as CEO and acquires his independent film and TV studio, Panoramic Media  —  The move comes six months after Bill Block vacated the role  —  Jonathan Glickman will fill the position of CEO at Miramax, the studio announced Tuesday.

item.title: ビリー・エイリッシュ、ケイティ・ペリーら200人以上が、AI開発者とテック企業に対し、声を盗み、アーティストを置き換える「略奪的」AIを断罪する書簡に署名（Sara Fischer/Axios）

Sara Fischer / Axios:
Billie Eilish, Katy Perry, and 200+ others sign a letter to AI developers and tech companies decrying “predatory” AI that steals voices, replaces artists, more  —  - Jen Jacobsen, executive director at The Artist Rights Alliance (ARA), the trade group representing the artists signing the letter …

item.title: WorldCatを所有する非営利の図書館技術協同組合OCLCが、20カ国で500以上の図書館が利用するデジタル貸出サービスCloudLibraryを買収（John Maher/Publishers Weekly誌）
item.description:
John Maher / Publishers Weekly:
Nonprofit library tech cooperative OCLC, which owns WorldCat, acquires CloudLibrary, a digital lending service used by ~500 libraries in 20 countries  —  Nonprofit library technology cooperative OCLC—the company behind WorldCat, the world's largest global catalog of library collections …

item.title: MoffettNathansonは、2026年末までにYouTube TVの米国での加入者数は〜12.4Mとなり、ComcastとCharterを抜いて国内最大の有料テレビ・プロバイダーになると予測している（Matthew Keys/The Desk）。
item.description:
Matthew Keys / The Desk:
MoffettNathanson forecasts YouTube TV will have ~12.4M US subscribers by 2026's end, passing Comcast and Charter to become the country's biggest pay TV provider  —  Google's streaming cable television alternative YouTube TV is on track to overtake Comcast's Xfinity TV and Charter's Spectrum TV …

item.title: CBSとゴールデングローブ賞は、第82回授賞式を2025年1月5日にCBSで生中継、米国ではParamount+でストリーミング放送する予定（Kimberly Nordyke/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Kimberly Nordyke / The Hollywood Reporter:
CBS and the Golden Globes plan to air the 82nd annual ceremony on January 5, 2025, live on CBS and streaming on Paramount+ in the US  —  Organizers also finalized the timetable for submissions across the awards' film and TV categories.  —  CBS and the Golden Globes have set Jan. 5 as the date for the 82nd annual ceremony.

item.title: ヤフー、ニュースアプリ「Artifact」を買収、単体アプリは閉鎖、今後数カ月でヤフーニュースや他のサービスにその技術を活用予定（David Pierce/The Verge）
item.description:
David Pierce / The Verge:
Yahoo acquires the news app Artifact, shuts down its standalone app, and plans to use its technology on Yahoo News and other services in the coming months  —  Instagram's co-founders built a powerful and useful tool for recommending news to readers — but could never quite get it to scale.

item.title: 買い物客による商品レビュー動画を提供するマーケットプレイス「フリップ」が、AppLovinからの5,000万ドルを含む1億4,400万ドルのシリーズCをStreamlined主導で10億5,000万ドルの評価額で調達（Spencer Soper/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Spencer Soper / Bloomberg:
Flip, a marketplace with product review videos by shoppers, raised a $144M Series C led by Streamlined at a $1.05B valuation, including $50M from AppLovin  —  - Ad software firm AppLovin invested $50 million in commerce app  — App features video reviews of products made by other shoppers

item.title: アマゾン、英国のMGM+顧客にライオンズゲートとスターツのコンテンツを提供する契約を締結、他の欧州諸国と中南米でも同様の契約（Georg Szalai/Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Georg Szalai / Hollywood Reporter:
Amazon strikes a deal to offer Lionsgate and Starz content to MGM+ customers in the UK, following similar deals for other European countries and Latin America  —  The service will offer series and movies from Lionsgate and Starz in the U.K., including ‘Outlander,’ giving customers access to more hit series and movies.
